ygData.subject: Re: Effect of Intelligence
ygData.msgSnippet: Are you sure of your mana ? i am at level 13 and i get 430-450 mana (i can cast 4 bind afinity and one shock of ice spel without med). But my int is 142.... So
ygData.messageBody:
Are you sure of your mana ? i am at level 13 and i get 430-450 mana (i can
cast 4 bind afinity and one shock of ice spel without med). But my int is
142.... So two level more with 115 you already get 480 ? (i gain something
like 50-60 mana per level).
Did someone already test that ? the more intelligence you get, the more mana
you get ok it s a fact. But did someone know how to put that fact into
numbers ?? (10 intelligence more = 10 mana more per level or something like
that ? )


thanks !


yakos

level 13 wizzard

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Spehar, David J [SMTP:David.Spehar@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, April 20, 1999 3:46 PM
> To: 'eq_wizards@onelist.com'
> Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: Effect of Intelligence
>
> From: "Spehar, David J" <David.Spehar@...>
>
> Whatever you choose is good. Think of it this way. Your stats also are
> roll played. I.E. my 15th level Wizzie has 118 Intel and 55 strength..but
> has 90 CHARISMA and 90 STAMINA. His wisdom is now 99 with help of an
> item.
> Anyway, point here is that your wiz will be just fine.
>
> Mana is to a wizard as Hitpoints are to a fighter class. Some fighters
> have
> 500pts at level 17, some get the 500pts at 18. Doesnt really matter. You
> will enjoy your wizard and learn the positive and negative effects of your
> choices.
>
> Mine is that I have about 480 mana at level 15 but I cannot carry more
> than
> 55 in loot.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Ken Lee [mailto:kenlee@...]
> Sent: Monday, April 19, 1999 5:15 PM
> To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: Effect of Intelligence
>
>
> From: "Ken Lee" <kenlee@...>
>
> I only have 100 Int, figured that was enough, but as a human I've got some
> other better stats. I don't see any REAL detriment till perhaps later on.
> Later on we'll have less mana, so perhaps 1 less damage spell goes off. So
> far I haven't really noticed a big deal. However, let me point out that
> what
> you're doing is playing the numbers. It's like having a D&D character with
> 18/00 str. Sure, it's nice, but if we all played them then it'd get stale
> fast.
>
> That's just my opinion, and that's why I stopped putting points into my
> int
> at 100/
>
>
> Zalbar
> 14th Wizard
> Solusek Ro
>
